column_desc: Unique identifier for each sales order header record in the Ponpure_SaleorderHdrs table. Primary key that distinguishes one sales order from another and links to corresponding line items in Ponpure_Saleorderdtls. Used to track the overall sales order entity and its associated details.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve all line items associated with a specific sales order header. Essential for generating order summaries, invoices, or delivery documents where both header and line details are required together.

Use this join when analyzing quote-to-order conversion rates or comparing final order terms against original quoted terms. Helps identify changes made during order confirmation or understand pricing deviations from quotations.

column_desc: Identifier linking back to the specific line item in the quotation that originated this sales order. Used for tracking which quotation line items were converted into sales order line items. Essential for detailed quote-to-order reconciliation at the product level.

joins.description: Use this join for granular analysis of which specific quotation line items converted to sales orders. Helps track conversion rates at the product/SKU level and analyze changes between quoted and ordered items.

column_desc: Reference number of the original quotation that led to this sales order. Used to track the sales pipeline from quotation to final order and analyze conversion rates across different quotation types and sources.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve original quotation details when analyzing the full sales cycle from quote to order. Essential for sales performance analysis and understanding customer decision-making patterns.

column_desc: Date when the original quotation was issued to the customer. Used to calculate the time between quotation and order conversion, and for analyzing sales cycle duration by product category or customer segment.

Identifier for the original customer enquiry that initiated the sales process. Used to track the complete sales funnel from initial enquiry through quotation to final order, enabling analysis of conversion rates at each stage.

Date when the customer initially made the enquiry. Used to calculate total sales cycle time from first contact to order confirmation, and for analyzing sales pipeline efficiency across different channels or regions.

Transaction type identifier categorizing the nature of the sales order (e.g., taxable intra-state, taxable inter-state, stock transfer, sample). Determines tax treatment, documentation requirements, and business process flow.
Sub-category identifier providing additional classification within transaction types. Used for more granular business process routing, tax calculation, and reporting requirements.
Identifier for the business unit or division within the company responsible for the sales order. Used for organizational segmentation, profit center accounting, and internal performance reporting.
Identifier for the specific company location or branch handling the sales order. Used for inventory allocation, delivery scheduling, and branch-level performance analysis.
Identifier for the sales representative or collector responsible for the customer account and order. Used for sales performance tracking, commission calculation, and customer relationship management.

Unique identifier for the customer placing the order. Links to master customer data including name, address, credit terms, and historical transaction patterns for relationship management and analytics.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve customer master data such as name, address, credit terms, and contact information for order processing and customer analysis.

column_desc: Identifier for the billing address location of the customer. Used for invoice generation, tax calculation, and accounts receivable processing when customer has multiple billing locations.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve detailed billing address information, tax registration details, and billing contact information for invoice generation.

column_desc: Identifier for the shipping/delivery address location of the customer. Used for delivery scheduling, logistics planning, and shipment documentation when customer has multiple delivery locations.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve detailed shipping address information, delivery instructions, and contact details for logistics and delivery planning.

column_desc: Status indicator for the quotation associated with this sales order. Used to track the lifecycle stage of quotations and understand which statuses lead to successful order conversions.
Expiry date until which the original quotation remains valid. Used to analyze order conversion timing relative to quotation validity periods and identify expired quotations.

Flag indicating whether this is a back-to-back order (order placed only after receiving confirmation from supplier). Used for inventory planning, procurement strategies, and order fulfillment tracking.
Additional email addresses for order notifications and communications. Used for sending order confirmations, shipping updates, and invoices to multiple stakeholders within the customer organization.
Customer account site identifier linking to the specific customer location account details. Used for financial accounting, credit management, and site-specific business terms.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve customer account-specific information such as payment terms, credit limits, and banking details for order processing and financial controls.

column_desc: Type or method used for creating the original quotation (e.g., manual, system-generated, template-based). Used for process analysis and optimization of quotation generation workflows.

Descriptive name of the transaction type (e.g., 'Taxable - Inter State', 'Taxable - Intra State', 'Stock Transfer - Intra State'). Provides human-readable classification for reporting and user interfaces.
Currency code in which the sales order is denominated (e.g., INR, USD, EUR). Determines pricing, payment processing, and foreign exchange calculations for international transactions.
Customer's purchase order reference number provided for this sales order. Used for order tracking, invoice matching, and customer communication reference.
Date of the customer's purchase order. Used for order validation, contract compliance checking, and understanding order timing relative to customer procurement cycles.
Date when the customer's purchase order was received by the company. Used for process timing analysis, order acknowledgment timelines, and customer service level agreement monitoring.

Date used for currency conversion rate calculation when order currency differs from company base currency. Essential for accurate financial reporting and profit calculation in multi-currency environments.
Type of currency conversion method used (e.g., spot rate, forward rate, average rate). Determines the financial accounting treatment and exchange rate risk management approach.
Exchange rate used for currency conversion. Critical for accurate financial reporting, profit calculation, and cost analysis in international transactions.
Flag or indicator showing whether the order triggered a credit limit alert. Used for credit risk management, order approval workflows, and customer credit monitoring.
Identifier for the sales person in Oracle or ERP system. Used for sales performance tracking, commission calculation, and integration with HR and compensation systems.
Code or reference for the sales person in Oracle or ERP system. Used for system integration, reporting, and cross-referencing between different business systems.
Type of invoice to be generated for this order (e.g., tax invoice, commercial invoice, proforma invoice). Determines invoice format, content requirements, and regulatory compliance.
Indicator distinguishing between trading goods and manufactured goods. Used for inventory classification, cost accounting, and business process routing.
Free-text field for additional comments, special instructions, or notes related to the sales order. Used for communication of special requirements, delivery instructions, or order exceptions.
Currency of the price list used for order pricing. Used for multi-currency pricing strategies and understanding pricing consistency across different currency markets.
Identifier for the specific price list used for order pricing. Links to pricing master data for audit trails, price verification, and historical price analysis.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve detailed pricing information including price list versions, effective dates, and pricing terms for order validation and analysis.

column_desc: Flag indicating whether branch-specific alerts or notifications were generated for this order. Used for exception management, branch coordination, and special handling requirements.
User identifier of the person who created the sales order record. Used for audit trails, process accountability, and user activity tracking.
Date and time when the sales order record was created in the system. Used for order processing timelines, system performance monitoring, and chronological reporting.
User identifier of the person who last updated the sales order record. Used for change tracking, update accountability, and maintaining data integrity audit trails.
Date and time when the sales order record was last updated. Used for tracking order modifications, understanding update frequency, and maintaining data change history.
Identifier for export contracts when applicable. Used for international trade documentation, export compliance, and contract-based order processing.
Export contract number for international shipments. Used for customs documentation, export licensing, and international trade compliance.
Identifier for brokers or intermediaries involved in the transaction. Used for commission calculations, intermediary management, and channel partner tracking.
Identifier linking to internal production or delivery schedules. Used for integrated planning between sales, production, and logistics functions.
Date when branch-specific alerts were sent for this order. Used for monitoring alert response times, branch coordination efficiency, and exception handling performance.
Identifier linking to Document Management System for order-related documents. Used for digital document tracking, archiving, and retrieval of order-related paperwork.

Unique primary key identifier for each quotation header record. Automatically generated sequential number that serves as the main reference for tracking quotation proposals throughout their lifecycle from creation to conversion or expiry.

joins.description: Use this join to identify which quotations successfully converted into sales orders. Essential for sales performance analysis, conversion rate tracking, and pipeline management.

column_desc: Business reference number for the quotation following company's numbering format (e.g., PPC/2025-26/98146). This is the external-facing identifier shared with customers and used for tracking in commercial documents.

joins.description: Use this join to link quotations to their resulting sales orders for conversion analysis and order-quotation reconciliation.

column_desc: Date when the quotation was formally created and issued to the customer. Represents the starting point of the quotation validity period and is used for aging analysis of pending quotations.
Reference to the original customer enquiry or RFQ that initiated this quotation. Links the quotation back to the initial customer request in the enquiry management system.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve the original enquiry details that led to this quotation creation.

column_desc: Numeric code identifying the transaction type category (e.g., 1=Taxable, 4=Export, 7=Stock Transfer). Determines the tax treatment, accounting entries, and regulatory compliance requirements for the quotation.

joins.description: Use this join to get the descriptive transaction type name and related configuration parameters.

column_desc: Sub-classification within the transaction type (e.g., 3=Inter State, 4=Intra State, 5=Export). Provides granular classification for tax jurisdiction, compliance rules, and business process routing.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve detailed sub-type descriptions and associated business rules.

column_desc: Identifier for the selling company entity within the corporate group. Determines which legal entity is offering the quotation and will be responsible for fulfillment and invoicing.

joins.description: Use this join to get company details like legal name, registration information, and financial parameters.

column_desc: Specific GSTIN registration identifier for the selling company location. Essential for tax compliance and determines the place of supply for GST calculations.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve complete GSTIN details and associated tax registration information.

column_desc: Physical location/branch identifier from where the quotation is issued. Determines inventory availability, shipping point, and local jurisdiction considerations.

joins.description: Use this join to get location details including address, contact information, and operational capabilities.

column_desc: Employee identifier for the sales representative or collector responsible for this quotation. Used for sales performance tracking and commission calculations.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve salesperson details, contact information, and team assignments.

column_desc: Unique identifier for the customer receiving the quotation. Links to master customer records containing legal entity details, credit terms, and relationship history.

joins.description: Use this join to access complete customer information including name, address, credit limits, and classification details.

column_desc: Specific customer site identifier for billing/invoicing purposes. Used when customers have multiple delivery locations but centralized billing arrangements.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve billing address details, contact persons, and billing-specific instructions.

column_desc: Specific customer site identifier for physical delivery/shipment. Determines the destination address for logistics planning and delivery documentation.

joins.description: Use this join to access shipping address details, delivery instructions, and receiving hours.

column_desc: Current workflow status of the quotation (e.g., 1=Draft, 3=Sent to Customer, 6=Approved, 8=Converted to Order). Tracks the quotation through various stages of the sales approval and customer response process.

joins.description: Use this join to get status descriptions, workflow rules, and next possible actions for each status.

column_desc: Code identifying the reason for quotation creation or modification (e.g., new customer, price revision, tender participation). Used for sales analysis and process improvement tracking.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve descriptive reason codes and categorization for analysis.

column_desc: Internal approval workflow status indicating whether the quotation has been authorized for release to customer (0=Pending, 1=Approved, 2=Rejected). Controls whether quotation can be formally issued.

joins.description: Use this join to get approval workflow details and authorization hierarchy information.

column_desc: Free-text field for internal notes, special instructions, or comments about the quotation. Used for communication between sales, pricing, and approval teams.
Expiry date of the quotation offer after which prices and terms are no longer guaranteed. Critical for customer commitment and order conversion timing.
Flag indicating whether this quotation is linked to a supplier purchase order (1=Yes, 0=No). Used for drop-shipment scenarios or when inventory needs to be procured upon customer order.
Date when internal approval was granted for the quotation. Used for process efficiency measurement and compliance tracking.
Additional email addresses for quotation distribution beyond the primary customer contact. Used for CC recipients or secondary stakeholders.
Customer account site identifier linking to the financial accounting system. Used for integrated billing and accounts receivable processing.

joins.description: Use this join to access financial account details, payment terms, and credit information.

column_desc: Method by which the quotation was created (1=Manual, 2=From Enquiry, 3=From Order). Indicates the source system or process that generated this quotation.
Descriptive name of the transaction type (e.g., 'Taxable - Inter State', 'Stock Transfer - Intra State'). Human-readable version of trans_type_id for reporting and display purposes.
Sequential number within the quotation series for the specific company/division. Used for internal tracking and reference alongside the formal quotation number.
User ID of the employee who originally created the quotation record in the system. Used for audit trail and responsibility assignment.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve creator details including name, department, and contact information.

column_desc: System timestamp when the quotation record was initially saved in the database. Used for audit purposes and process timing analysis.
User ID of the employee who last modified the quotation record. Part of the change tracking and audit control system.

joins.description: Use this join to get details of the last modifier for change tracking and accountability.

column_desc: System timestamp of the most recent modification to the quotation record. Used for version control and identifying stale quotations.
Error messages from integration attempts with external systems (ERP, CRM, etc.). Used for troubleshooting synchronization issues between platforms.
Reference to export contract or agreement for international shipments. Links to regulatory compliance documentation for cross-border transactions.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve export contract details including terms, validity, and regulatory requirements.

column_desc: Business reference number of the export contract for display and documentation purposes. Used on shipping and customs documents.
Quotation identifier from Sales Force Automation or CRM system for integration tracking. Ensures consistency between sales tracking and order management systems.
Customer purchase order comments or special instructions referenced in the quotation. Captures customer requirements that influence pricing or delivery terms.
Synchronization remarks from system integration processes. Technical notes about data exchange between different business systems.
Customer's purchase order number referenced in the quotation. Used for order matching and customer reference tracking.
Date of customer's purchase order referenced in the quotation. Used for order validation and commitment tracking.
Additional reference numbers from customer systems or documents. Captures secondary identifiers for complex procurement processes.
Currency code for the quotation (e.g., INR, USD). Determines pricing basis and foreign exchange considerations for international transactions.
Exchange rate applied for currency conversion in multi-currency quotations. Critical for foreign currency pricing and financial reporting.
Import-Export code for international trade compliance. Required for customs clearance and regulatory reporting on export shipments.
Incoterms or delivery conditions (e.g., FOB, CFR, CIF). Defines risk transfer, cost allocation, and responsibility for international shipments.
Mode of transport for pre-carriage segment in multi-modal shipments (e.g., By Sea, By Road). Part of the complete logistics chain specification.
Port identifier for loading goods onto vessels for sea shipments. Critical for export documentation and logistics planning.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve port details including name, location, and facilities information.

column_desc: Port identifier for discharging goods at destination for sea shipments. Required for complete shipment routing and documentation.

joins.description: Use this join to access destination port details for logistics and documentation.

column_desc: Country identifier for final destination beyond port of discharge. Used for complete shipment tracking and regulatory compliance.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve country details including name, codes, and trade regulations.

column_desc: Specific location identifier for final delivery point. Provides granular destination information beyond country level.

joins.description: Use this join to access detailed destination information including address and local requirements.

column_desc: Indicates whether partial shipments are allowed (Yes/No). Important for logistics planning and customer delivery requirements.
Classification of supply type (e.g., LCL, CONTAINER). Determines packaging, handling, and transportation requirements.
Packaging type description (e.g., BAGS, HDPE DRUM, NEW STEEL DRUM). Specifies physical packaging requirements for the goods.
Shipping container type (e.g., 20' FCL, 40' FCL). Specifies the standard container size for sea freight shipments.
Total monetary value of the quotation including all line items before taxes and charges. Represents the base commercial value of the proposed transaction.
Total freight charges included in the quotation. Separately tracked for cost analysis and customer billing transparency.
Total insurance charges included in the quotation. Important for risk management and cost allocation in international shipments.
Free On Board value for export quotations. Represents the goods value at the port of loading, excluding freight and insurance.
Estimated or committed dispatch time from warehouse. Used for customer delivery planning and logistics coordination.
Duration for which the quotation offer remains valid (e.g., '3 DAYS', '3 days'). Communicates the time limit for customer acceptance.
Indicates whether trans-shipment is allowed during transportation (Yes/No). Important for complex international logistics routes.
Total quotation amount expressed in words for legal documentation. Used on formal quotation documents to prevent misinterpretation.
Bank identifier for payment instructions or letter of credit details. Links to banking information for international transactions.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve bank details including name, branch, and account information.

column_desc: Agent or broker identifier for export/import transactions. Used for third-party logistics or customs brokerage services.

joins.description: Use this join to access agent details including contact information and service agreements.

column_desc: Commission amount payable to agents or brokers. Separately tracked for financial reporting and partner settlement.
Special remarks or instructions for export shipments. Captures regulatory, documentation, or handling requirements for international trade.
Division or business unit identifier for billing purposes. Used in multi-division organizations for revenue allocation.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve division details including name, financial parameters, and management structure.

column_desc: Date on which the currency conversion rate was determined. Important for audit trail in multi-currency transactions.
Type of conversion rate applied (e.g., 1000=Standard). Indicates the rate source or calculation method for currency conversion.
Identifier for the price list applied to this quotation. Determines the pricing structure and discount schemes used.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve price list details including validity, currency, and pricing rules.

column_desc: Descriptive name of the price list applied (e.g., 'Standard', 'USD Price List'). Human-readable reference for pricing verification.
Detailed description of delivery terms, location, or special instructions. Provides complete delivery information for customer reference.
Flag indicating whether quotation PDF document has been sent to customer (1=Yes, 0=No). Tracks document distribution in the sales process.
Status code for quotation closure (e.g., 0=Open, 1=Closed Won, 2=Closed Lost). Final disposition tracking for sales pipeline management.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve closure reason descriptions and categorization for sales analysis.

column_desc: Alternative customer header identifier for system integration or legacy data. Used in complex customer hierarchy scenarios.

joins.description: Use this join to access alternative customer hierarchy information for complex organizational structures.

column_desc: Flag indicating whether this is a preliminary quotation before formal quote (1=Yes, 0=No). Used for initial pricing discussions without formal commitment.
Customer name as displayed on quotation documents. May differ from master customer record name for specific quotation purposes.
Market circle or territory code for sales organization. Used for regional sales performance tracking and territory management.
Reference to preliminary quotation if this is a revised or formal version. Tracks quotation revision history and version control.

joins.description: Use this self-join to retrieve details of the preliminary quotation that preceded this formal quotation.

column_desc: Flag indicating whether customer approval has been received (1=Yes, 0=No). Tracks customer response in the sales process.
Flag indicating whether customer has referred back the quotation for clarification (1=Yes, 0=No). Tracks customer queries and revision requests.
Flag indicating whether customer has rejected the quotation (1=Yes, 0=No). Final disposition tracking for lost opportunities.
Flag tracking email notifications sent to other collectors or business managers. Used for communication tracking in team sales scenarios.
Number of times the quotation has been revised. Tracks version history and indicates negotiation complexity.
Reference to Return Material Authorization if quotation is related to product returns. Links quotation to reverse logistics processes.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve RMA details when quotation is related to product returns or replacements.

column_desc: Reference to original quotation if this is a copy or duplicate. Used for quotation replication and template-based creation.

joins.description: Use this self-join to retrieve details of the original quotation that was copied to create this one.

column_desc: Reference to customer contact or service request that initiated this quotation. Links quotation to customer service interactions.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve customer service request details that led to quotation creation.

column_desc: Primary customer email address for quotation communication. Used for electronic distribution and correspondence tracking.
Market circle code associated with the creating user. Used for territory-based access control and reporting.
Flag indicating cross-market or cross-segment quotation (1=Yes, 0=No). Identifies quotations that span multiple territories or business segments.
Reference to parent quotation in complex multi-level quotation scenarios. Used for bundled offerings or master-agreement quotations.

joins.description: Use this self-join to retrieve parent quotation details in hierarchical quotation structures.

column_desc: User ID of person who referred back the quotation for clarification or revision. Tracks internal workflow handoffs.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve details of the user who referred back the quotation.

column_desc: Previous status before the quotation was referred back. Maintains status history for workflow tracking.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve the status description before referback for workflow analysis.

column_desc: Flag indicating whether the quotation has edit access restrictions (1=Restricted, 0=Open). Controls modification permissions in workflow stages.
Reference to sample request or lead that generated this quotation. Links quotation to product sampling or trial activities.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve sample request details that led to quotation creation.

column_desc: Status code for quotation verification process (e.g., 0=Not Verified, 1=Verified). Tracks quality assurance or compliance verification steps.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve verification status descriptions and related workflow information.

column_desc: Comments from the quotation verification process. Captures quality notes, compliance observations, or approval conditions.
Reasons cited during quotation verification or rejection. Documents the basis for verification decisions.
Flag indicating whether item-level details were edited after initial creation (1=Yes, 0=No). Tracks modifications to quotation line items.
Flag indicating whether purchase order references were edited (1=Yes, 0=No). Tracks modifications to customer PO information.
Document Management System header identifier for quotation documents. Links to electronic document storage and version control.

joins.description: Use this join to retrieve document management details including file references and access controls.

column_desc: Flag indicating whether quotation was created for a walk-in customer (1=Yes, 0=No). Identifies quotations from direct customer visits without prior engagement.
Unique sequential identifier for each line item in the sales order. Primary key of the SaleOrderdtls table, used to uniquely identify and reference individual product/service entries within an order.

joins.description: Join to retrieve delivery and dispatch information for this specific order line item, including shipment status, delivery dates, and transportation details.
Join to access production or delivery scheduling information related to this specific order line, including planned production dates, resource allocation, and schedule tracking.

column_desc: Foreign key reference to the parent sales order header in Ponpure_SaleOrderHdrs table. Links this line item to its master order record containing customer information, overall order terms, and transactional metadata.

joins.description: Mandatory join to retrieve the parent sales order header information including customer details, order date, payment terms, and overall order status for this line item.

column_desc: Unique identifier for the product or service being ordered. References the master item/product catalog to retrieve product descriptions, specifications, and inventory information.

joins.description: Join to retrieve detailed product information including item description, product category, specifications, and technical attributes for this ordered item.

column_desc: Unit of Measure code indicating the measurement unit for the ordered quantity (e.g., KG for kilograms, EA for each, BOX for boxes, L for liters). Standardizes quantity measurements across different product types.
Numerical quantity of the item being ordered, expressed in the unit specified by uom_code. Represents the exact amount of product or service requested by the customer.
Price per unit of the item before any discounts or taxes, expressed in the order currency. Represents the base selling price agreed upon for this specific line item.
Name or description of the price list applied to this line item. Indicates which pricing catalog or customer-specific price agreement was used to determine the unit price.
Unique identifier referencing the specific price list record used for pricing this line item. Links to the master price list table containing pricing rules and validity periods.

joins.description: Join to retrieve detailed price list information including pricing rules, validity dates, customer-specific pricing agreements, and discount structures applied to this order line.

column_desc: Type of discount applied to this line item (e.g., percentage discount, fixed amount discount, promotional discount). Indicates the category or nature of the discount being offered.
Percentage discount rate applied to the unit price of this line item. Expressed as a decimal or percentage value representing the discount rate off the base price.
Total calculated price for this line item after applying quantity, unit price, and discounts (but before taxes). Formula: (quantity  unit_price) - discount_value. Represents the extended line value.
Description of the packaging configuration for this line item. Indicates how the product is packaged for delivery (e.g., '1X500ML', '27X185', '5 BOX', '2X180').
Identifier for the source location or warehouse from which this item will be delivered. References the inventory organization or shipping point responsible for fulfilling this line item.

joins.description: Join to retrieve information about the source inventory organization, warehouse location, storage facilities, and operational details for order fulfillment.

column_desc: Code identifying the freight/shipping terms applicable to this line item (e.g., FOB, CIF, EXW). Determines responsibility for shipping costs, insurance, and risk transfer during transit.

joins.description: Join to retrieve detailed freight term definitions, shipping responsibilities, cost allocation rules, and delivery obligations for this order line.

column_desc: Classification category for the sales transaction type of this line item. Indicates the business context or sales channel (e.g., 'E-Commerce', 'Intact', 'Repack', 'Bulk').
Identifier for the payment terms applicable to this line item. References the payment conditions table containing due dates, discount periods, and payment method requirements.

joins.description: Join to retrieve detailed payment term information including due dates, early payment discounts, late payment penalties, and payment method specifications for this order line.

column_desc: Type of container or drum used for packaging this item, particularly relevant for liquid or bulk chemical products. Indicates packaging specifications and handling requirements.
Manufacturer or brand information for the product being ordered. Indicates the specific make, brand, or manufacturer of the item, particularly for branded or OEM products.
Scheduled or promised delivery date for this specific line item. May differ from the overall order delivery date for items with different lead times or availability.
Identifier for the inventory organization responsible for stocking and managing this item. References the organizational unit that owns the inventory and handles stock management.

joins.description: Join to retrieve detailed inventory organization information including location details, storage capabilities, handling requirements, and organizational hierarchy for stock management.

column_desc: Harmonized System Nomenclature code for the item, used for GST/tax classification in India. Standardized code for product classification in taxation and customs documentation.
Applicable tax rate percentage for this line item. Represents the GST/VAT/tax rate applied to the taxable value of this product or service.
Reason code or description for why the related quotation line was closed or converted to this order line. Used for tracking quotation-to-order conversion analysis.
Identifier for the reason code associated with this line item, particularly for special handling, discounts, or order modifications. References standard reason codes table.

joins.description: Join to retrieve descriptive reason codes and explanations for special handling, pricing adjustments, order modifications, or exceptions applied to this line item.

column_desc: Product group or category classification for the ordered item. High-level categorization used for reporting, analysis, and business intelligence purposes.
Flag indicating whether a specific price list was applied to this line item ('Y' for yes, 'N' for no). Used to identify lines with customized or special pricing arrangements.
Absolute monetary value of discount applied to this line item (in order currency). Represents the actual discount amount rather than percentage rate.
Additional price list information or reference, potentially containing pricing tier details or special price agreement references beyond the basic price_list_id.
Detailed packaging instructions or specifications for this line item. May include special handling requirements, packaging materials, labeling instructions, or compliance information.
User identifier of the person who created this sales order line item. References the system user who entered or generated this order line record.

joins.description: Join to retrieve information about the user who created this order line, including user details, department, and contact information for audit and tracking purposes.

column_desc: Date and time when this sales order line item was created in the system. Used for audit trails, process timing analysis, and chronological tracking of order entry.
User identifier of the person who last modified this sales order line item. References the system user who made the most recent change to this record.

joins.description: Join to retrieve information about the user who last updated this order line, useful for change tracking, responsibility assignment, and audit compliance.

column_desc: Date and time when this sales order line item was last modified. Used for tracking changes, version control, and identifying recent updates to order details.
Current processing status of this sales order line item. Indicates where the line is in the order fulfillment lifecycle (e.g., 'OPEN', 'Closed', 'Shipped', 'Cancelled').
Foreign key reference to the corresponding line item in the quotation details table. Links this sales order line back to its original quotation line for traceability and conversion analysis.

joins.description: Join to retrieve the original quotation line details that were converted to this sales order line, enabling comparison of quoted vs ordered terms, prices, and quantities.

column_desc: Identifier for export contract items, used for international sales and export documentation. Links to export-specific contract terms and compliance requirements.
Code or reference number for export contract items. Used for export documentation, customs declarations, and international trade compliance tracking.
Number of days agreed for delivery or other contractual timeframes specific to this line item. Used for service level agreements and delivery commitment tracking.

Flag indicating whether this line item originates from an internal source or transfer (e.g., inter-company, intra-company, stock transfer). Distinguishes internal transactions from external customer sales.
Inventory organization identifier for internal source transactions. Specifies the sending inventory organization for internal stock transfers or inter-company shipments.

joins.description: Join to retrieve information about the source inventory organization for internal transfers, including location details and organizational structure for internal logistics.

column_desc: Identifier for the parent schedule in internal planning or production scheduling systems. Links this order line to higher-level production or material planning schedules.

joins.description: Join to retrieve parent scheduling information for internal planning purposes, including production schedules, material requirements, and capacity planning details.

column_desc: Reason code or description for automatic closure of this order line item. Used when system automatically closes lines due to business rules, time limits, or other automated processes.
Date and time when this order line was automatically closed by the system. Used for audit trails and tracking of automated business process executions.
Document Management System line identifier for external system integration. Used for cross-reference with external DMS or ERP systems for document tracking and synchronization.

Unique identifier for each schedule record in Ponpure_Schedules. Note: This column is NOT the same as line_id in Ponpure_SaleOrderdtls or Ponpure_DispatchDetails. In Ponpure_Schedules, this serves as the primary key for schedule records and should not be confused with sales order detail line identifiers.

Foreign key reference to Ponpure_SaleOrderHdrs.header_id. Identifies the parent sales order header to which this schedule belongs. This link connects delivery schedules to their originating sales order for customer and organizational context.

joins.description: Use this join to access sales order header information such as customer details, order date, order status, and commercial terms for schedules. Required for understanding the complete order context of delivery schedules.

column_desc: Foreign key reference to Ponpure_SaleOrderdtls.line_id. Identifies the specific sales order line item to which this delivery schedule applies. This is a critical link for associating delivery plans with the actual products/items ordered.

joins.description: Mandatory join to access sales order line details such as item information, quantities, pricing, and delivery commitments for schedules. Essential for fulfillment tracking and delivery planning against specific order lines.

column_desc: Identifier for the specific product/item being scheduled for delivery in Ponpure_Schedules. Represents the master item code for the scheduled product. Note: This should be distinguished from item_id in other tables; in schedules context, it specifically identifies the item being delivered.

Alternate item identifier used in Ponpure_Schedules when a substitute or alternative product is scheduled instead of the original ordered item. This field tracks product substitutions at the delivery schedule level.
Category classification for the sale in Ponpure_Schedules, indicating the type of sales transaction (e.g., Intact, Repack, Bulk, E-Commerce). This affects packaging, pricing, and delivery handling.
Customer identifier in Ponpure_Schedules, referencing the customer receiving the scheduled delivery. This provides customer context for delivery planning and tracking.
Planned delivery date for the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. This is the target date when the delivery is supposed to occur as per the delivery plan.
Revised delivery date in Ponpure_Schedules when the original schedule date has been changed. Captures date adjustments due to delays, customer requests, or logistical issues.
Reason code or description for schedule rescheduling in Ponpure_Schedules. Documents why a delivery date was changed, such as customer requests, logistical constraints, or production delays.
Planned delivery time slot for the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Indicates the specific time window or session (e.g., '30:00.0', 'I Session', 'II Session') for delivery.
Inventory organization identifier in Ponpure_Schedules, indicating which warehouse or storage location is responsible for fulfilling this delivery schedule.
Original date requested by the customer for delivery, as recorded in Ponpure_Schedules. This may differ from the scheduled date due to availability or logistical constraints.
Quantity planned for delivery in this specific schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. This may be a partial quantity of the total order quantity, as orders can be split across multiple deliveries.
Actual quantity that has been dispatched or shipped for this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Tracks fulfillment progress against the scheduled quantity.
Actual date when the goods were dispatched for this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Records the physical shipment date for tracking delivery performance.
Actual time when dispatch occurred for this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Provides granular timing information for shipment tracking.
Billing address identifier for the customer in Ponpure_Schedules. Links to the customer site where invoices should be sent for this delivery.
Shipping address identifier for the customer in Ponpure_Schedules. Specifies the delivery location where goods should be shipped for this schedule.
Status identifier for the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules (e.g., 1=Pending, 3=Approved, 4=Confirmed, 6=Dispatched). Tracks the current state of the delivery schedule in the fulfillment process.
Status of the Shipping Order Confirmation (SOC) in Ponpure_Schedules. Indicates whether shipping confirmation has been received or processed for this delivery schedule.
Confirmation status identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Indicates whether the delivery schedule has been confirmed by relevant parties (e.g., customer, logistics).
Reason code identifier in Ponpure_Schedules for various schedule actions or statuses (e.g., rescheduling reasons, cancellation reasons, special handling codes).
Free-text comments or notes associated with the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Used for internal remarks, special instructions, or explanatory notes about the delivery.
Approval status identifier for the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Indicates whether the delivery schedule has been approved by required authorities (e.g., sales manager, logistics).
Cost associated with packaging for this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Records any special packaging expenses incurred for this specific delivery.
Size specifications for packaging in Ponpure_Schedules. Describes the packaging dimensions or container size used for this delivery (e.g., '45X205', '27X185').
Total ordered quantity for the sales order line in Ponpure_Schedules. This represents the complete quantity ordered, which may be delivered across multiple schedules.
Detailed packaging information in Ponpure_Schedules. Provides specific instructions or descriptions about how goods should be packed for this delivery.
Customer account site identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Links to the specific customer location or account site for billing and shipping purposes.
Previously scheduled quantity in Ponpure_Schedules. Tracks the quantity from earlier schedule versions when schedules are modified or rescheduled.
Type of drum or container used for packaging in Ponpure_Schedules (e.g., 'Non-Returnable', 'Returnable'). Important for chemical or bulk liquid deliveries.
Freight terms identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Specifies the Incoterms or shipping responsibility (e.g., FOB, CIF, EXW) for this delivery.
Product group or category for the scheduled item in Ponpure_Schedules (e.g., 'PUREPRINT', 'SOLVESSO 200', 'TEXTILE PURE'). Used for product categorization and reporting.
Payment terms identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Links to the payment conditions agreed for this delivery (e.g., net 30, advance payment).
Tax amount or tax code applied to this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Records tax calculations specific to this delivery instance.
Flag indicating back-to-back delivery enablement in Ponpure_Schedules. Marks schedules that are part of consecutive or linked delivery sequences.
Unit price for the scheduled item in Ponpure_Schedules. Represents the price per unit at the time of scheduling, which may differ from order price in special cases.
Quotation number reference in Ponpure_Schedules. Links this delivery schedule back to the original quotation, if applicable, for traceability.
Organization identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Specifies the business unit or company entity responsible for this delivery schedule.
Name of the inventory organization in Ponpure_Schedules. Provides the human-readable name of the warehouse or storage facility handling this delivery.
Code for the inventory organization in Ponpure_Schedules. Short identifier or code for the warehouse facility.
Delivery source location identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Specifies the specific point or sub-location within the inventory organization from which delivery originates.
Time component of rescheduling in Ponpure_Schedules. Records the specific time when a schedule was rescheduled, if applicable.
User identifier who created the schedule record in Ponpure_Schedules. Tracks the originator of the delivery schedule for audit purposes.
Date when the schedule record was created in Ponpure_Schedules. Provides audit trail for schedule creation timing.
User identifier who last updated the schedule record in Ponpure_Schedules. Tracks the most recent modifier for change management.
Date when the schedule record was last updated in Ponpure_Schedules. Provides audit trail for schedule modifications.
Agreed delivery lead time in days for this schedule in Ponpure_Schedules. Represents the negotiated or promised delivery timeframe.
Flag indicating if the schedule was created or modified via mobile application in Ponpure_Schedules. Tracks the channel through which schedule changes were made.
Validation error messages from Unicommerce integration in Ponpure_Schedules. Stores error details when schedule data fails validation in external e-commerce systems.
External sale order item identifiers from Unicommerce in Ponpure_Schedules. Maps schedule items to corresponding items in external e-commerce platforms.
Type of request associated with the schedule in Ponpure_Schedules (e.g., 'CRM', 'WMS', NULL). Indicates the source system or type of request that generated this schedule.
Flag indicating internal source scheduling in Ponpure_Schedules. Marks schedules that originated from internal transfers or inter-company movements.
Internal source inventory organization identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Specifies the source warehouse for internal transfer schedules.
Flag for internal quotation creation in Ponpure_Schedules. Indicates if the associated quotation was created for internal purposes.
Flag for internal data editability in Ponpure_Schedules. Controls whether schedule data can be modified for internal transfer schedules.
Child schedule identifier for internal hierarchies in Ponpure_Schedules. Links child schedules to parent schedules in multi-level delivery planning.
Parent schedule identifier for internal hierarchies in Ponpure_Schedules. Links this schedule to its parent schedule in hierarchical delivery structures.
Parent Shipping Order Confirmation (SOC) identifier in Ponpure_Schedules. Links to parent SOC documents for consolidated shipments.
Flag indicating schedule data edit permissions in Ponpure_Schedules. Controls whether schedule details can be modified after creation.
Flag indicating if the schedule involves recalled products in Ponpure_Schedules. Marks deliveries related to product recalls or returns.
Unique identifier for each lead record in the Ponpure_Leaddetails table. This is the primary key used to uniquely identify individual lead records within the system.
Lead number or reference code assigned to track and identify the lead within business processes. This may include different prefix codes indicating lead types (MOBILE, LEAD - FLV, LEAD - IND, etc.).
Email address of the lead contact person or primary point of contact for communication and follow-up activities.
Indicates the level of interest or priority of the lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for capturing lead interest scoring or classification.
First name of the lead contact person. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for storing the contact person's first name.
Salutation or title of the lead contact person (Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr., etc.). Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for proper addressing in communications.
Last name of the lead contact person. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for storing the contact person's last name.
Industry or business sector of the lead company. This categorizes leads by their primary business activity (ELECTRONICS, PAINT & COATINGS, PHARMA, etc.).
Website URL of the lead company. May contain company websites, email addresses, or other web references.
Branch or location code associated with the sales user handling the lead. Represents geographical or organizational divisions within the company (COIMBATORE, DELHI-I, HYDERABAD - II, etc.).
Boolean flag indicating whether the lead has been converted to a customer or sales opportunity. TRUE indicates conversion, FALSE indicates still in lead stage.
Job title or designation of the lead contact person. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for capturing the contact's position within their organization.
CRM Sales Order Confirmation number linking the lead to specific sales order documents in the CRM system.
Field indicating whether the lead requires immediate action or follow-up. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for action priority tracking.
Free-text field containing notes, observations, or comments about the lead from sales personnel. Captures qualitative information about customer needs, product requirements, or sales interactions.
examples: Customer want this product to purchase.
New Customer belt mfg toluene monthly one brl using.

column_desc: Type of product the lead is interested in. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for categorizing leads by product category.
Indicates whether the lead involves export business. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for tracking international vs. domestic business.
Source through which the lead was originally presented or generated. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for lead source tracking.
Identifies whether the contact person is the decision maker for purchasing. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for sales strategy planning.
Name of domestic supplier if the lead is currently purchasing from another local supplier. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for competitive analysis.
Date and timestamp when the lead record was originally uploaded or created in the system. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
Planned date for the next follow-up action or milestone in the lead management process. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for sales activity scheduling.
Name or code of the branch, region, or collector responsible for managing the lead. Often matches user_branch but can differ in some cases.
Additional descriptive information about the lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for extended descriptions beyond the comments field.
Check or flag indicating whether the lead has been assigned to a sales representative. Numeric values may represent different assignment statuses.

Current status of the lead in the sales pipeline. Numeric codes represent different stages (1: New, 2: Contacted, 3: Qualified, 4: Credit Evaluation, 5: Proposal, 6: Negotiation, 7: Won/Converted, 8: Lost/Rejected).

Source code indicating how the lead was generated. Numeric codes represent different channels (0: Unknown, 1: Referral, 2: Website, 3: Trade Show, 4: Advertisement, 5: Cold Call, 6: Email Marketing, 7: Social Media, etc.).
Company name associated with the lead. In this context, appears to contain customer ID values rather than company names.

Unique identifier for the customer in the system. This is the primary key of the Ponpure_Leaddetails table and serves as the foreign key when joining with Ponpure_SaleOrderHdrs to analyze sales orders by customer.

joins.description: Use this join when analyzing sales orders in the context of customer information from Ponpure_Leaddetails, such as identifying sales patterns by customer type, region, or lead source. This join should be LEFT OUTER because you may want to see all customers/leads regardless of whether they have sales orders.

column_desc: Single character flag indicating whether email alerts have been sent for this lead. 'Y' indicates alerts sent, other values or NULL indicate no alerts sent.
Extended or detailed description of the lead requirements, background, or special considerations. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for comprehensive lead documentation.
General or overall status of the lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for high-level status categorization.
Status indicating whether and how the lead was closed. Contains values like 'Rejected' for closed-lost leads or NULL for open/active leads.
Specific reason or option selected when closing the lead. Contains free-text explanations for lead closure decisions.
examples: PL CHECK THE POTENTIAL ANC CORRECT
PL CORRECT POTENTIAL QTY AND VALUE
kindly check the potential value and correct .

column_desc: Additional comments or notes provided when the lead was closed. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for closure documentation.
Credit ID or reference to credit evaluation records. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for linking to credit assessment documentation.
Credit assessment details or rating. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for credit evaluation results.
Reference number linking to secondary or parallel approval processes. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for multi-level approval tracking.
Flag indicating the type of sales (R: Regular, B: Bulk, 0: Not specified, etc.). Used to categorize sales by volume, pricing, or contractual terms.

Application synchronization flag indicating whether the lead data has been synchronized with other applications. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for integration tracking.
Application-specific lead identifier used for integration with external systems. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for cross-application reference.
Date and time when the lead was approved by management. Contains timestamp values for approved leads or NULL for pending approvals.
Comments or notes from the approver regarding the lead approval decision. Contains free-text approval justifications or conditions.
User ID or identifier of the person who submitted the lead for approval. Numeric codes representing different users in the system.
Log identifier for tracking changes or events related to the lead. Currently appears to contain numeric values that may represent log sequence numbers.
Current approval status of the lead. Contains values like '0' (Pending), '1' (Approved), '2' (Rejected), '3' (Closed), etc.
Full name of the customer or company associated with the lead. This is the primary business name used for identification and reporting.
Primary business segment or category for the lead. Categorizes customers by product line or business focus (General Chemicals, Performance Chemicals, NPD, etc.).
Customer number or account number assigned to the lead for tracking and reference. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for customer account identification.
Legal structure or business type of the customer company (SOLE PROPRIETORSHIP, PRIVATE LIMITED, PARTNERSHIP, LLP, etc.).
Additional comments specific to lead management. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for sales team notes.
Competitor name if the lead is currently purchasing from a competitor. Contains competitor names or product references for competitive analysis.
Product category of the competitor's product being used by the lead. Helps identify competitive products and market positioning.
Price at which the competitor is selling similar products to the lead. Used for competitive pricing analysis and negotiation strategy.
User ID of the person who created the lead record. Numeric codes representing different users in the system.
Date and timestamp when the lead record was originally created in the system. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
User ID of the person who last updated the lead record. Numeric codes representing different users in the system.
Date and timestamp when the lead record was last updated. Uses a custom format (HH:MM.SS) for time updates or full timestamp for major changes.
Date when a sales visit or meeting was conducted with the lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for tracking sales activities.
Boolean flag indicating whether a sales visit has been conducted with the lead. TRUE indicates visit completed, FALSE indicates no visit yet.
Boolean flag indicating whether credit evaluation has been performed for the lead. TRUE indicates credit check completed, FALSE indicates pending.
Boolean flag indicating whether this is a temporary customer record. TRUE indicates temporary customer, FALSE indicates permanent customer record.
Reference to previous quotation ID if this lead is a follow-up on an earlier quote. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for tracking quote history.
Identifier linking to the original enquiry that generated this lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for enquiry-to-lead tracking.
Flag indicating whether closure notification emails have been sent for this lead. '0' indicates no alerts sent, other values may indicate alert status.
Approval ID for lead closure process. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for closure authorization tracking.
Flag indicating whether market circle assignment notification emails have been sent. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for assignment workflow tracking.
Customer number of the referring party if this lead came through a referral. Contains numeric referral codes for tracking referral sources.
Name of the referring customer or partner who referred this lead. Used for tracking referral networks and partner performance.
Flag indicating whether notes or documentation request emails have been sent for this lead. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for documentation workflow.
Header ID linking to cover potential data or opportunity sizing information. Currently appears to be NULL in the sample data but is reserved for opportunity analysis.
Temporary closure status identifier for leads in transitional states. '0' indicates not temporarily closed, other values may represent interim statuses.
Reason code for lead closure. '0' indicates no specific reason or lead still open, other values may represent closure reasons.
Market circle code assigned to the user handling the lead. Represents geographical sales territories or market segments (COI02, IND02, HYD04, etc.).
Flag indicating whether the lead has cross-market circle or segment access permissions. FALSE indicates restricted to assigned market circle, TRUE may indicate broader access.
Billing site use ID for customer billing location mapping. '0' indicates no specific billing site defined, other values represent billing location identifiers.
Previous lead ID if this record is an update or revision of an earlier lead. '0' indicates no previous lead, other values represent earlier lead versions.
